intro: Hieracium stranigense, commonly known as the Stranigense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny exposures. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium stranigense is often found in rocky or grassy areas and is an important part of the local flora in its native range.
